alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Hardin (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 01 at 11:47AM CST until further notice by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Tennessee River at Savannah affecting Hardin and Decatur Counties. For the Tennessee River...including PICKWICK DAM HEADWATER, Pickwick Dam, Savannah, Saltillo, Perryville, Johnsonville...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Tennessee River at Savannah. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 365.0 feet, Cornstalk Lane going to Nightingale Lane is flooded at Cypress Pond Slough. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 365.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 365.1 feet Tuesday afternoon, March 1st. It will then fall to 364.6 feet later Tuesday evening. It will then rise again but remain below flood stage. - Action stage is 365.0 feet. - Flood stage is 370.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1200 AM CST.
